refnamediv.refpurpose: Install one or several external modules

refsynopsisdiv.title: Syntax
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: result = atomsInstall(modules) result = atomsInstall(modules, section) result = atomsInstall(file)

listitem.para: m x 1, m x 2 matrix of strings

tr.td: Version: if this field is empty or is not present, the most recent version is used

listitem.para: m x 1 matrix of strings containing the file-system path.
This argument controls where the external module is installed.
section is a single-string and its value should be :
"allusers": the external module is installed for all users of the computer and is located in SCI/contrib ("allusers zone").
"user": the external module is only installed for the current user and is located in SCIHOME/atoms ("user zone").
If SCI/contrib is write accessible, "allusers" is the default value. Otherwise, the default value is "user".

tr.td: Installation section: this parameter determines whether the module has been installed for all users or only for the current user.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: atomsInstall installs one or several external modules.

note.para: By default, atomsInstall tries to install modules from ATOMS remote repositories. To install a module from a local file, you have to switch ATOMS to offline mode by using atomsSetConfig("offline","True")" command.

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.para: Example 1: Installing a module from a repository
Example 2: Installing a module from a local archive. As well as installing modules from the central repository, you can also install modules directly from your own machine.

revision.revdescription: When a module has no binary compiled for the running Scilab M.m version but has published (former) sources, atomsInstall automatically tries to compile them.
